meanings.definition: The amount of bombs that a plane can carry.
meanings.sent1: The bombload of the aircraft was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The pilot checked the bombload before takeoff.
meanings.sent3: The bombload on the plane made it look like a flying fortress.
meanings.sent4: The bombload of responsibilities on his shoulders felt overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The bombload in the cargo hold rattled with each bump.

meanings.definition: The weight of bombs carried by a plane.
meanings.sent1: The bombload was carefully calculated for the mission.
meanings.sent2: The crew unloaded the bombload after the mission.
meanings.sent3: The bombload on the aircraft made it seem heavier than usual.
meanings.sent4: The bombload of worries weighed heavily on his mind.
meanings.sent5: The bombload in the storage area clinked as it shifted.

meanings.definition: To load a plane with bombs.
meanings.sent1: The ground crew worked quickly to bombload the aircraft.
meanings.sent2: They bombloaded the plane with precision and speed.
meanings.sent3: He bombloaded the plane as if it were a giant puzzle.
meanings.sent4: She bombloaded the aircraft efficiently and effectively.
meanings.sent5: The team bombloaded the plane in record time.
